item.title: Causal Inference
item.description:
This course teaches the canonical research designs in causal inference:

  1. Introduction to Causal Inference based on DAGs
  2. Instrumental Variables
  3. Marginal Treatment Effects
  4. Regression Discontinuity
  5. Differences-in-Differences
  6. Synthetic Controls

The course is mainly based on Causal Inference: The Mixtape by Scott Cunningham and Mostly Harmless Econometrics by Josh Angrist and Steve Pischke. It also teaches some advanced material like regression kink designs or difference-in-differences with staggered adoption.

You can see an example for a video here:

item.title: Public Economics
item.description:
This video series comprises of 50 videos on Public Economics at the undergraduate level. The course follows the textbook Public Finance and Public Policy by Jonathan Gruber. The video series consists of 5 playlists:

  1. Tools of Public Economics
  2. Public Goods
  3. Externalities
  4. Income Distribution and Welfare Programmes
  5. Taxation

Emmanuel Saez has a great set of lecture slides that cover the same material.

You can see an example for a video here:

item.title: Metrics Nuts and Bolts
item.description: In this video series, I answer frequently (and not so frequently) asked questions about undergraduate econometrics. The channel is work in progress, but a first example for a video can be found here:

item.title: Intuitive Metrix
item.description:
Many econometrics courses teach methods in the sequence maths-examples-applications, i.e. they first explain the mathematics, then show empirical examples, and then let students work through applications in the lab. The aim of Intuitive Metrix is to teach econometrics based on intuitive explanations and visuals such as animations, videos, and dashboards. This website is not meant as a substitute for conventional econometrics courses but rather as a complement. For some students – especially for visual learners – this format may be helpful.

The website is currently work in progress. The aim is to have a fully-fledged website in late 2023.
